intro: Stylocoryna alpestris, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and typically grows in high-altitude environments such as alpine meadows and rocky slopes. The plant is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in areas with well-drained soil. Stylocoryna alpestris is adapted to cold climates and is considered a hardy, frost-resistant species.
